moves.1. c4: Not sure about this move.  I think that e4 or d4 would have been better.
moves.2. d4 Bg7 3. e3: White should develop his pieces instead of moving pawns.  Now his bishop is blocked in.
moves.5. Nf3 O-O 6. h3 d5 7. b3 dxc4 8. bxc4 N: With all the attacking by black, white hasn't had a chance to castle.  This will be his undoing.  Black will keep the attack going and white won't know what hit him.
The e5 knight can't take the d7 knight because it is pinned to the a1 rook.
moves.13. f4: This doesn't do anything to take the knight.
moves.13... Nxe5 14. fxe5 Bxe5 15. Nd2: Now the bishop is hanging.  The queen will move once in the game.
moves.15... Qxd3: This is the only time that the queen has and will move.  It's very rare to checkmate an opponent with only one queen move and I'm glad that I did it.
moves.16. Rb1: White was trying to protect his rook, but that isn't the biggest threat...............
moves.16... Bg3#: .............this is.  Checkmate.  I know that I didn't annotate this very well, but I just wanted to share my favorite win.
